page.title: 01Head of Loch Craignish
page.content: Loch Craignish is situated on the west coast of Scotland between Oban and Lochgilphead. The area is called Barbreck. The scenery consists of mostly rocky hills with pastures for sheep and cattle. There are few small lochs asd boggy areas, Loch Craignish is a sea loch. The A83 runs through the area north to south with the B8006 turning off to Ardfern. There are not many dewellings. A large house at Barbreck with other houses being occupied mostly by shepherds and people working the land. There are a number of incomers who have either started their own small businesses or taken jobs or are unemployed. Unemployment is a problem here as elsewhere. There are few holiday homes. The area attracts a lot of tourists. One houe also does a yacht charterage.
